title: bzip2 required but can't be spack installed & is not listed in prerequisites

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
<!-- Explain, in a clear and concise way, the command you ran and the result you were trying to achieve.
Example: "I ran `spack find` to list all the installed packages and ..." -->

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
spack install gcc@9.3.0
<snip>
==> Installing gmp
==> No binary for gmp found: installing from source
tar (child): lbzip2: Cannot exec: No such file or directory
tar (child): Error is not recoverable: exiting now
/usr/bin/tar: Child returned status 2
/usr/bin/tar: Error is not recoverable: exiting now
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 2:
    '/usr/bin/tar' '-oxf' '/tmp/centos/spack-stage/spack-stage-gmp-6.1.2-7dgljbuxqrigl347avxrml4xbkgs5ymc/gmp-6.1.2.tar.bz2'
==> Warning: Skipping build of mpfr since gmp failed
==> Warning: Skipping build of gcc since mpfr failed
==> Warning: Skipping build of mpc since mpfr failed
==> Warning: Skipping build of isl since gmp failed
==> Error: Installation of gcc failed.  Review log for details
```

On the slack channel I was told this needed `bzip2` installing. This doesn't seem to be available via spack, which is problematic for unprivileged users. It's also not listed in the [prerequisites](https://spack.readthedocs.io/en/latest/getting_started.html#prerequisites).


### Information on your system

* **Spack:** 0.15.4-592-319d160
* **Python:** 3.8.3
* **Platform:** linux-centos7-cascadelake

### Additional information

<!-- These boxes can be checked by replacing [ ] with [x] or by clicking them after submitting the issue. -->
- [x ] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
